fields.description:
*Summary:*
By default Bitbucket Cloud displays number of builds that exist for the pull request and only update once the build is completed.
Given customer usually have Build scheduled from their CI servers ex. Jenkins the build phrase "0 out X number of builds" is misleading and users would assume that they are not scheduled.

*Recommendation:*
Re-phrasing the status to "{color:#FF0000}0 out X number of build are Scheduled{color}" or if Bitbucket could identify the build *succeeded/in-progess/scheduled* & shown as a status over the PR view. This would help resolve any confusions user may have had.

fields.description:
I Wanted to use a docker build command in a bitbucket pipelines step but figuered out that COPY commands in Dockerfiles never uses docker cache. 
It seems you can't shorten image build process by installing dependencies before program files. 
{code:java}
FROM composer:latest

## the following 2 commands will nerver use cache 
COPY app/composer.json app/WORKDIR app
RUN composer install --no-interaction 


COPY app/src src/
COPY app/tests tests/

CMD [ "php", "./tests/index.php" ]
{code}
fields.summary: COPY commands in Dockerfile never use docker cache

h3. Issue Summary
With the last available slot in workspace's user plan, the User who received multiple repository invite can only accept the first invitation; the user will get the following error while trying to accept the other repo invitation.
 !image-2020-06-24-09-31-04-963.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure workspace settings to match the following condition:
#* *Free* plan
#* 4 users on the workspace plan
https://bitbucket.org/<WorkspaceID>/workspace/settings/plans-and-billing
# Navigate to repository settings and invite a new user
#* Perform the same for another repository
# Request the user to accept the invitations
(i) The user should get the same error while accepting the second invitation

Users occasionally face with "Something went wrong" when loading the PR diff and a 555 response when checking DevTools, even when the PR diff is small. Noticeable feature is that the PR facing this issue with the diff can contain a large binary file 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # This is an intermittent issue and is reproducible only on some repositories, 

h3. Expected Results

For the diff to load and skip binary files, since GIT cannot diff those
h3. Actual Results

Users are facing the following error "Something went wrong" in the Bitbucket UI. 

Checking DevTools > network Tab , we see a 555 response 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround apart from viewing the Diff locally and then merging using Bitbucket or Bitbucket API 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/merge]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever there's an exceedingly big file in a pull request, the next files in the pull request will fail to load despite using the single-file diff mode.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a PR with a file with 50k+ changes;
# All files that appear before the large file in the file tree in the right corner of the PR page will load their diff perfectly fine.
# All files that appear after the large file in the file tree, including the large file, will state "empty diff"

h3. Expected Results
All files would load correctly except the large file when using the single-file diff mode.

h3. Actual Results
Other files' diff load attempts get affected if there's an exceedingly large file in the diff.

h3. Workaround
There are two workarounds here:
1) Add the large file in the excluded files list.
2) Check diffs on old PR, loading each file manually.
fields.summary: Extremely large diffs break the PR diff view even on single-file mode

fields.description:
The issue with so called foxtrot merges is described here: [https://blog.developer.atlassian.com/stop-foxtrots-now]

Syncing a branch of a PR causes such a merge, meaning, the base branch occurs as the 2nd parent in the git merge commit.

*The base branch should be the the first parent of the sync commit.*

The point is, that a plain "merge" is not suited for a "sync".

When syncing manually, I usually do a merge branch to master, then exchanging the branch pointers, so master is effectively unchanged and the feature branch points to the merge commit.

In the console this would look something like:
{code:bash}
 Switched to branch 'master'
 Your branch is up to date with 'origin/master'.
 PS>git merge feature-c -m "Sync branch 'feature-c' with master"
 Merge made by the 'recursive' strategy.
 another-file.md | 3 ++-
 1 file changed, 2 insertions, 1 deletion
 PS>git checkout feature-c
 Switched to branch 'feature-c'
 Your branch is up to date with 'origin/feature-c'.
 PS>git reset --hard master
 HEAD is now at f203008 Sync branch 'feature-c' with master
 PS>git push
 PS>git checkout master
 Switched to branch 'master'
 Your branch is ahead of 'origin/master' by 2 commits.
 (use "git push" to publish your local commits)
 PS>git reset --hard origin/master
 HEAD is now at bca2ff9 edited some-file.txt on master
{code}
fields.summary: Prevent foxtrot merges when using the "sync" feature on pull requests

fields.description:
It's possible to create Jira issues from within a comment in a PR on Bitbucket by navigating to the comment in the PR > Create Jira issue.

When using this feature, it's possible to select which project the issue should be created to on Jira's side, and the first project shown in the dropdown is the first in alphanumeric order.

This feature request is to add the ability to set which branch will show up first in that list.

The reasoning for this is that if you have many projects in Jira, coupled with a possibly slow network, the time it takes to choose the branch in the dropdown is pretty long.
fields.summary: Default Jira project on issue creation inside Bitbucket

fields.description:
Related issue: BCLOUD-408

I maintain a popular utility called [{{git-open}}|http://github.com/paulirish/git-open] which opens a browser to your bitbucket/github/gitlab to view whatever branch you have checked out.

Bitbucket makes this pretty difficult if there's a slash in the branch name. (Which it surprisingly common :)

----
For example, in the {{Guyzmo/git-repo}} project, following [the official docs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/hyperlinking-to-source-code-in-bitbucket-824476709.html] I can view the {{devel}} branch with this URL:\\
[{{https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/devel}}|https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/devel]

Easy enough, but here's the problem:

For the {{bugfix/conftest_fix}} branch, bitbucket provides a 404 for a similar URL: [{{https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/bugfix/conftest_fix}}|https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/bugfix/conftest_fix]\\
And we get the same result if we URL-encode the slash: [{{https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/bugfix%2Fconftest_fix}}|https://bitbucket.org/guyzmo/git-repo/src/bugfix%252Fconftest_fix]

_When using the site to view the branch we get a {{/src/<commit hash>/?at=<branch/name>}} URL.  So while this is a workaround, it makes for more awkward ergonomics. :/_

----
Ideally, a fix would make either of the above 404'ing URLs start to work. Thanks!
fields.summary: Source view URL of branch name with slashes broken  (e.g. "feat/foo")

fields.description:
Sometimes pull request is so big that Bitbucket doesn't want to display it unless by one file. In this case user have to click navigational buttons in the header (prev/next) or select file in file tree to see file diffs. Ongoing review of such pull request can be done without concerns by clicking interested for user files in file tree, but when you want to do a final review and to go through the whole list of changes one by one, it's hard to click +100 times on the same button. Viewing some files changes can be faster (when it's a line changed) then moving on next file by clicking on Next button, and it makes the whole process of reviewing to fill like more clicking process the reviewing process.

So, it would be grate to have a hotkeys to speedup switching to next/prev file, maybe just Left Arrow / Right Arrow.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Hotkeys for navigating to next/prev files in pull request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, *_Jira issues_* view in Bitbucket repository show “Jira issues from linked projects” where the linked project is a project containing at least one issue that has been referenced in a commit/Pull Request or branch in the repository using smart commit.

That means *_Jira issues_* view will show all Jira issues in the project even if only one of the issues from the project is linked to the commit/Pull Request or branch in the repository.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link one commit/Pull Request or branch in the repository using smart commit
 # Observe that *_Jira issues_* view will display all issues instead of the Jira issue linked

h3. Expected Results

There should be a filter to display only the Jira issues which have commit/Pull Request or branch linked in the repository 
h3. Actual Results

*_Jira issues_* view in Bitbucket repository show “Jira issues from linked projects” where the linked project is a project containing at least one issue that has been referenced in a commit/Pull Request or branch in the repository using smart commit.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Provide filter to display only linked Jira issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Pull Request has multiple comments, those can be viewed from the "main" Pull request section under Pull Request description.  However, if you try to view those same comments from the Activity view on the right hand side, users do not have an ability to scroll through and view older comments.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any Open Pull request
 # Add a few comments to it, 3 or more
 # Look under Activity > Expand it > Filter > All Comments
 # You will only be able to partially see a very first comment on that PR, but no other and there is no ability to scroll through to view all comments on the PR

h3. Expected Results

To be able to view PR comments from the Activity view feed as well
h3. Actual Results

No ability to scroll through to view them 
h3. Workaround

Users should be able to view Comments from the "Main" section of the Pull request, right under Description section .

Or , users can use our API to view all comments by making a GET call to the Pull request comments endpoint: 

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/comments#get]
fields.summary: Activity Feed on Pull Request view doesn't allow users to scroll/view all comments

fields.description:
Why this tool is important for you to use with Bitbucket? Is there a problem we're not addressing and it's causing you to look into using this tool with Bitbucket? What benefits would you see from having this built?

The issue is code quality consistency. We would like all code that's checked in to be correctly formatted in exactly the same way. Being able to run code formatting on check-in would ensure that it's always done. 

Microsoft does something like this to their repositories. The result is that all their code looks the same, no matter who wrote it. We've got a half a dozen coding styles and at least two IDEs in use... would be great to ensure that it's standardized.
fields.summary: Integration with JIndent to standardize code formatting

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some users are unable to logout from Bitbucket in Safari browser if _*Prevent cross-site tracking*_ option is enabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Bitbucket (bitbucket.org) using Safari browser
 # Verify if _*Privacy->Website tracking->Prevent cross-site tracking*_ option is enabled. Enable this option if it is not enabled already
 # Log out from Bitbucket by clicking on Avatar on the lower left corner

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to logout from Bitbucket successfully
h3. Actual Results

User should be able to logout from Bitbucket and redirected to Bitbucket overview page.
h3. Workaround

To support logout:
 * Uncheck _*Privacy->Website tracking->Prevent cross-site tracking*_ option in Safari browser

To support changing accounts:
 * Affected users should visit [https://id.atlassian.com/login/select-account?application=bitbucket&continue=https://bitbucket.org] where they will be able to add/switch between two Atlassian Accounts
fields.summary: Unable to logout from Bitbucket in Safari browser

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a Bitbucket user exceeds our API rate limits and this user is trying to access the source code of repos in Bitbucket UI, they will see an error message 'Having trouble showing that directory'.

This is because the UI is using API calls to display info and the calls are getting rate limited.

However, the reason for this error is not clear to the user, unless they open the Developer tools panel and see the 429 errors. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve the error message shown to the user in those cases, to let them know that it is a rate limiting issue.
fields.summary: Improve UI error message when a user hits the API rate limit

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When removing a user group, the warning dialogue box mentions "Are you sure you want to remove the group (user group)?"

This warning is vague and does not inform the user on exactly what repositories will be affected by removing the user group. 

It is even possible for the admin to remove all user groups for a repository without being aware of the consequences, causing the repository's settings to be unviewable and require help from the support team to regain admin access to the repository.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Please provide a warning message that mentions the impact of repository permissions that will be affected when a user group is removed.
fields.summary: Please provide a warning that shows the full impact when removing user groups

fields.summary: When switching on "load files individually", it'll cause the page to scroll

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Define a file path in artifacts block in bitbucket-pipelines.yaml fails to render the value and generate artifacts.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Use the following config:

{code:java}
..
..
- step:
    name: Test
    script:
         - mkdir app && ls && git archive --format=zip master -o ./app/$APP_NAME.zip && ls ./app
    artifacts:
         - app/$APP_NAME.zip
{code}
Artifacts won't be generated.
h3. Expected Results

It should generate an artifact with name $APP_NAME.zip
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2020-06-05 at 17.10.41.png|width=609,height=532!
h3. Workaround

To use glob patters:
{code:java}
..
- step:

    script:
         - mkdir app && ls && git archive --format=zip master -o ./app/$APP_NAME.zip && ls ./app

{code}

fields.description:
Currently, if you have 3 steps and you want to update/remove files from an existing artifact on the 2nd step generated in the 1st step, the artifacts will not be removed when you get it on the 3rd step because Artifacts combines the files.
{code:java}
    - step:
        name : Generate Artifact
        script:
          - some commands that add files into the vendor folder
        artifacts:
           - vendor/**       
    - step:
          name : Use Artifact 1
          script:
           - some commands that remove files into the vendor folder
          artifacts:
           - vendor/** 
    - step:
          name : Use Artifact 2
          script:
           - Check the vendor folder but files aren't deleted
          artifacts:
           - vendor/**
{code}
*Feature Request:*
 It would be great if we could have an option to replace an existing cache instead of combining it.
 *E.g.*
{code:java}
          artifacts:
           - vendor/**
             option: replace
{code}
fields.summary: Option to replace artifacts from a previous step instead of combining it

fields.description:
SARIF ([https://sarifweb.azurewebsites.net/)] is an industry standard format for the output of static analysis tools. Tools such as ShiftLeft Scan ([https://slscan.io/),] GitHub Semmle etc support this standard. ShiftLeft Scan is a free open-source DevSecOps tool.

With the current design of insights, an API call is required to the annotations endpoint to submit for each finding. A tool such as ShiftLeft Scan, by being a multi-scanner, can generate 100s of security findings per invocation thus requiring a better integration approach.

Please treat this issue as a request to support and integrate using SARIF in addition to API. ShiftLeft Scan already works with [Bitbucket pipelines|https://slscan.io/en/latest/integrations/bitbucket/] and can produce output in SARIF format as [discussed here|https://slscan.io/en/latest/integrations/sarif/]

Thank you.
fields.summary: Support SARIF format for code insights

you are able to add any user to a public repo without their consent

 # Scroll to the bottom of the first page of commits and click "Next"
 # At the top, switch from "All Branches" to "Master"
 # Note that you are now on page 1 of "Master" commits
 # Scroll to the bottom and click "Next"
 # DEFECT: Note that you have been navigated to page 2 of "All Branches" commits, not "Master"
 ** Each subsequent time you click next, you advance pages in "All Branches", not "Master"

h3. Expected Results
The filter should remain on the branch you've applied without reverting to "All Branches

h3. Actual Results
The filter applied ignored and is displaying "All branches"

h3. Workaround
The issue does not occur if the branches filter is applied before moving to the next page (Before clicking "next" on the bottom)

Apply branch filter before clicking "next"

fields.description:
I have two suggestions to regulate the usage of minutes for the pipeline. 

1) Pipeline should only run in schedule if new commits are present in that branch. Many times the pipeline will run in schedule even if there are no new commits which is a wastage of minutes and can be avoided by this solution. However even if someone wants to deploy the same commit they can manually run the pipeline. 

2) In Daily scheduled run exclude certain days to reduce wastage of pipeline minutes. For example many organizations have weekends off,  on those particular days there is no need to run the pipeline.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users intermittently unable to upload Binary files (PDF, exe, Jar etc.) in Downloads section in Bitbucket UI. The upload doesn't happen and receive 499 and then 502 status code.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload Binary files (PDF, exe, Jar etc.) in Downloads section in UI

h3. Expected Results

The upload should complete successfully and user should be able to see uploaded file in Downloads section
h3. Actual Results

The upload doesn't complete and receive 499 and then 502 status code in Dev console
h3. Workaround

Please use the following API to upload the file
{code:java}
 curl -s -u user_name:password -X POST https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/downloads -F files=@hello.txt
{code}
More information about API is available in [link|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/downloads]

Please note that if you are using 2-factor authentication (2FA) on your Bitbucket account, you cannot use your normal login password in the curl command, otherwise, you will see an error '\{"type": "error", "error": {"message": "To make a call, you need to use an app password."}}'. You must use an "App Password" instead.

More info about App Passwords and setting it up here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/app-passwords-828781300.html
fields.summary: Unable to upload Binary files in Downloads section

fields.description:
This documentation page suggests a repository owner create an App Password for a repository with repository write permissions and store it in a Repository Variable. This creates a critical privilege escalation.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/deploy-build-artifacts-to-bitbucket-downloads-981144761.html]

This creates a privilege escalation because even 'secured' repository variables are available to anyone with push permissions to the repository.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/variables-in-pipelines-794502608.html#Variablesinpipelines-Repositoryvariables]

By follow the recommended approach, the repository owner has inadvertently granted write permissions to all repositories they have write permission to, to any user with push permissions on the repository containing the App Password Repository Variable.

Further, all users with access to the Repository Variable are able to impersonate the repository owner while executing write requests on any repository that owner has write access too.

Ideally App Passwords should be able to be created per-repository. Further permissions should be significantly more fine-grained, so that it is possible to grant Downloads API write access, without also granting write access to all repository API methods.

A workaround is to create a service user with write access to just that one repo, then create an App Password for that user. However this user will then add your headcount and be charged as a full user.

TL;DR Bitbucket cloud API permissions are insufficiently fine-grained to support the documented use case.
fields.summary: Privilege Escalation via App Password in Repository Variable

fields.description:
Scenario:
 # User 1 creates a repository without creating a project
 # User 1 gives permission to User 2 to read the repository
 # User 2 see a project named "Untitled project" with description "Project created by Bitbucket for User 1"
 # Within that project User 1 can see the name of all the repositories User 1 had in the past that wasn't belonging to a project.

I wasn't in place of User 1, but if User 1 is not notified about the fact 4., it's not an acceptable behaviour.

Suggestion (you may have better idea):

Allow User 1 to decide if he want to share his project or not. There should be a way to share the repository only.

OR

When the User 1 want to share the repository that's belonging to the project, notify her about the fact that that project will also be visible to User 2.
fields.summary: Security vulnerability: I am able to see all projects of an other user if she shared me only one repository
